channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Sesame Street’ Signs New Streaming Deals With Netflix and PBS
item.description: The deal is a much-needed shot in the arm for Sesame Workshop, the nonprofit that produces “Sesame Street” and has been struggling financially.

item.title: Regeneron is buying 23andMe out of bankruptcy for $256 million
item.description: The deal still needs court approval.

item.title: UK and EU Strike Post-Brexit ‘Reset’ Deal
item.description: The agreement includes a new defense partnership and reduced checks on food and drink, removing some trade barriers after months of negotiations.

item.title: CBS News President to Depart Amid Network’s Tensions With Trump
item.description: Wendy McMahon, the president of CBS News and Stations, had allied herself with Bill Owens, the “60 Minutes” executive producer who recently resigned.

item.title: What companies need to know about Trump’s looming DEI deadline
item.description: Companies are preparing for the next battle in President Donald Trump’s war on corporate diversity, equity and inclusion policies.

item.title: Portuguese Center-Right Takes an Election. But Is the Hard Right the Victor?
item.description: While the center-right Democratic Alliance is set to rule Portugal again in a minority government, the hard-right Chega party, with its anti-immigrant...

item.title: Memorial Day travel set to break 20-year-old record with 45 million Americans taking trips
item.description: Like last year, about 87% of travelers are driving to their Memorial Day destinations, AAA said.

item.title: Parent groups are hosting fairs that showcase phones with limited features to try and keep children away from smartphones
item.description: The fairs, where “dumb” or restricted phones are exhibited to parents, have been popping up around the U.S.

item.title: What to expect at Fortune’s Most Powerful Women International Summit this week
item.description: Fortune's Most Powerful Women International Summit starts on Tuesday.

item.title: Will Trump’s Trade War Turn Canada’s Auto-Parts Capital Into a Ghost Town?
item.description: President Trump’s tariffs on auto parts are already causing job losses in Windsor, Ontario, the heart of an industry that makes components for vehicle...

item.title: Portuguese Center-Right Takes an Election. But Is the Hard Right the Victor?
item.description: While the center-right Democratic Alliance is set to rule Portugal again in a minority government, the hard-right Chega party, with its anti-immigrant...

item.title: UK and EU Strike Post-Brexit ‘Reset’ Deal
item.description: The agreement includes a new defense partnership and reduced checks on food and drink, removing some trade barriers after months of negotiations.

item.title: My First Thought When I Heard Joe Biden’s News
item.description: What Joe Biden understands about America’s place in the world, even now.

item.title: Pope Leo Meets With JD Vance as U.S. Conservatives Hopes for Better Relations
item.description: The talks took place as some on the American right who had clashed with Pope Francis, Leo’s predecessor, seek better ties with the papacy.

item.title: EU and UK Strike a Deal: What to Know
item.description: Top officials from Britain and the European Union gathered in London on Monday to announce a “reset” of post-Brexit relations.
